required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of a Eye Drop for Eye Allergy

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of an anti-allergy eyedrop.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Ocular Itching at Visit 3 (Day 0) at 7 Minutes Following Allergen Challenge, 16 Hours After Treatment Instillation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 3 (Day 0) 16 hours post-dose, at up to 7 minutes following Allergen Challenge
primary_outcome.description: A 0 to 4 scale used, allowing for half increment scores, where 0 indicates "none" and 4 indicates "incapacitating itch with an irresistible urge to rub"; measurement taken at up to 7 minutes following allergen challenge, 16 hours post treatment instillation.

primary_outcome.measure: Conjunctival Redness at Visit 3 (Day 0) at 20 Minutes Following Allergen Challenge, 16 Hours After Treatment Instillation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 3 (Day 0) At 20 minutes following Allergen Challenge, 16 hours post-treatment
primary_outcome.description: A 0 to 4 scale used, allowing for half increment scores to measure redness, where 0 indicates "none" and 4 indicates "extremely red"; measurement taken at 20 minutes following allergen challenge, 16 hours post treatment instillation.

primary_outcome.measure: Ocular Itching at Visit 4 (Day 14) at 7 Minutes Following Allergen Challenge, 15 Minutes Post- Treatment Instillation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 4 (Day 14) up to 7 minutes following Allergen Challenge
primary_outcome.description: 0 to 4 scale, allowing for half increment scores, where 0 indicates "none" and 4 indicates "incapacitating itch with an irresistible urge to rub"

primary_outcome.measure: Conjunctival Redness at Visit 4 (Day 14) at 20 Minutes Following Allergen Challenge, 15 Minutes Post Treatment Instillation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 4 (Day 14) At 20 minutes following Allergen Challenge
primary_outcome.description: A 0 to 4 scale used, allowing for half increment scores to measure redness, where 0 indicates "none" and 4 indicates "extremely red"; measurement taken at 20 minutes following allergen challenge, 16 hours post treatment instillation.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With a Visual Acuity Change From Visit 1 (Day -21) at Day -14
other_outcome.description: The number of eyes with any change in visual acuity measurements compared to Day -21.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With a Visual Acuity Change From Visit 1 (Day -21) at Day 0 Pre-dose, Pre-allergen Challenge
other_outcome.description: The number of eyes with any change in visual acuity measurements compared to Day -21

other_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With a Visual Acuity Change From Visit 1 (Day -21) at Day 14 Pre-dose, Pre-allergen Challenge
other_outcome.description: The number of eyes with any change in visual acuity measurements compared to Day -21

other_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With a Undilated Fundoscopy Changes From Visit 1 (Day -21) at Day 14
other_outcome.description: The number of eyes with any change to the following: Vitreous, Retina, Macula, Choroid, Optic Nerve

other_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With Slit Lamp Biomicroscopy Changes From Visit 1 (Day -21) at Day -14
other_outcome.description: The number of eyes with any change in the following: anterior chamber, conjunctiva, cornea, iris, lens, lids, tear meniscus

other_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With Slit Lamp Biomicroscopy Changes From Visit 1 (Day -21) at Day 0 Pre-dose, Pre-allergen Challenge
other_outcome.description: The number of eyes with any change in the following: anterior chamber, conjunctiva, cornea, iris, lens, lids, tear meniscus

other_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With Slit Lamp Biomicroscopy Changes From Visit 1 (Day -21) at Day 0 Post-dose, Pre-allergen Challenge
other_outcome.description: The number of eyes with any change in the following: anterior chamber, conjunctiva, cornea, iris, lens, lids, tear meniscus

other_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With Slit Lamp Biomicroscopy Changes From Visit 1 (Day -21) at Day 14 Pre-dose, Pre-allergen Challenge
other_outcome.description: The number of eyes with any change in the following: anterior chamber, conjunctiva, cornea, iris, lens, lids, tear meniscus

other_outcome.measure: Number of Eyes With Slit Lamp Biomicroscopy Changes From Visit 1 (Day -21) at Day 14 Post-dose, Pre-allergen Challenge
other_outcome.description: The number of eyes with any change in the following: anterior chamber, conjunctiva, cornea, iris, lens, lids, tear meniscus

arm_group.description: active treatment: administered as a single one-drop dose in each eye at each visit (Day 0 and Day 14).
Placebo, vehicle: administered as a single one-drop dose in each eye at each visit (Day 0 and Day 14).

intervention.description: 0.25% Ophthalmic Solution, one drop in each eye at each of two visits.
Vehicle without active, one drop in each eye at each of two visits.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 10 years of age
- positive history of ocular allergies
- positive skin test reaction to allergens.
Exclusion Criteria:
- known allergy, contraindication, or sensitivities to the use of any of the study medication(s) or their components
- ocular surgical intervention within three (3) months prior to visit 1 or during the study
- known history of retinal detachment, diabetic retinopathy, or progressive retinal disease, or glaucoma
- any other significant illness

group.description: active treatment: administered as a single dose of one drop per eye at each of two visits, Day 0 and Day 14.

group.description: inactive treatment: administered as a single dose of one drop per eye at each of two visits, Day 0 and Day 14.
